citRespParty.rpOrgName: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Ocean and Coastal Resource Management (OCRM), National Marine Protected Areas Center (MPAC)
NOAA's Ocean Service, National Marine Protected Areas Center (MPAC)

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
The MPA Inventory is a comprehensive catalog that provides detailed information for existing marine protected areas in the United States. The inventory provides geospatial boundary information (in polygon format) and classification attributes that seek to define the conservation objectives, protection level, governance and related management criteria for all sites in the database. The comprehensive inventory of federal, state and territorial MPA sites provides governments and stakeholders with access to information to make better decisions about the current and future use of place-based conservation. The information also will be used to inform the development of the national system of marine protected areas as required by Executive Order 13158.

In addition to those MPAs included in the National MPA Inventory, 3 additional areas were added by NOAA Fisheries since all three restrict commercial fishing. These include the state territorial seas of Washington and California, and the NMFS trawl rockfish conservation area (RCA) between the 100- and 150-ftm RCA boundaries. Other differences between this data layer and the one published originally by NOAA's Marine Protected Areas Center include the addition of several attribute fields to better describe what commercial gear types are or are not prohibited in these MPAs. See a description of fields in this metadata record.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: The inventory represents a collection of data compiled from various federal, state, tribal and territorial entities to provide a publicly available source of comprehensive information on place-based marine conservation efforts under U.S. federal, state, territorial, local, and tribal jurisdiction.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: NOAA Marine Protected Areas Center in joint effort with the US Department of the Interior

idPoC.rpOrgName: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Ocean and Coastal Resource Management (OCRM), National Marine Protected Areas Center (MPAC)

LegConsts.useLimit: See access and use constraints information.

Consts.useLimit: These data are in the Public domain. The data are not to be used for navigation. For more information, see the accuracy section.

dataIdInfo.suppInfo: This dataset consists of original boundaries as represented by the managing agencies, including any terrestrial components of the protected areas. Only the sub-tidal components of the areas meet the definition of an MPA. Version Notes: 2012: This version contains boundary updates during the 2011 calendar year. Boundaries were added for new MPAs created in California. Boundaries were updated for National Park Service, National Marine Fisheries Service, Washington, Virgin Islands and Wisconsin sites in the MPA Inventory. 2011: This version contains boundary updates during the 2010 calendar year. Boundaries were added for new MPAs created in California. Boundaries for Hawaii, American Samoa, Florida and National Marine Fisheries Service MPAs were added for sites already in the MPA Inventory. All National Park Service and National Estuarine Research Reserve and some National Wildlife Refuge boundaries were updated with original data. 2010: This version contains boundaries for all sites from authoritative sources as updated between 6/2009-12/2009. New data have been added for multiple states and territories, including Alaska, Florida, Maryland, North Carolina, New Hampshire, Ohio, Pennsylvania, US Virgin Islands and Wisconsin. Numerous shipwreck sites represented as latitude/longitude coordinate points were converted to polygons using a 300-meter radius buffer. NMFS sites have been verified against US Code of Federal Regulations.
dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.4.4000

prcStep.stepDesc: All data were reprojected to WGS 1984, decimal degrees.

GIS data for all sites were collected from authoritative sources. Data were either downloaded from public websites, requested directly from MPA managers or digitized based on legal definitions (eg US Code of Federal Regulations).
All site data were merged into a single shapefile.
MPA Inventory attribute data were appended to shapefile.
MPA Inventory shapefile was dissolved to one multipart polygon per site
All sites were reviewed by MPA Center to ensure a match between GIS data and MPA Inventory description.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Classification of the permanence of the site

edom.edomvd: MPAs or zones that have the potential, and often the expectation, to persist administratively over time, but whose legal authority has a finite duration and must be actively renewed or ratified based on periodic governmental reviews of performance
MPAs or zones whose legal authorities provide some level of protection to the site in perpetuity for future generations, unless reversed by unanticipated future legislation or regulatory actions

MPAs that are designed to address relatively short-term conservation and/or management needs by protecting a specific habitat or species for a finite duration, with no expectation or specific mechanism for renewal

attr.attrdef: Defines the primary characteristics of the area that the MPA was established to conserve.

edom.edomvd: MPAs or zones established and managed wholly or in part with the explicit purpose of supporting the continued extraction of renewable living resources (such as fish, shellfish, plants, birds, or mammals) that live within the MPA, or that are exploited elsewhere but depend upon the protected area?s habitat for essential aspects of their ecology or life history (feeding, spawning, mating, or nursery grounds).

MPAs or zones established and managed wholly or in part to sustain, conserve, restore, and understand the protected area's natural biodiversity, populations, communities, habitats, and ecosystems; the ecological and physical processes upon which they depend; and, the ecological services, human uses and values they provide to this and future generations.

MPAs or zones established and managed wholly or in part to protect and understand submerged cultural resources that reflect the nation's maritime history and traditional cultural connections to the sea.

attr.attrdef: Ecological scale of site conservation targets

edom.edomvd: MPAs or zones whose legal authorities and management measures specifically target a particular habitat, species complex, or single resource (either natural or cultural)
MPAs or zones whose legal authorities and management measures are intended to protect all of the components and processes of the ecosystem within its boundaries

attr.attrdef: Level of restrictions on commercial and/or recreational fishing

edom.edomv: Commercial Fishing Prohibited and Recreational Fishing Restricted
edom.edomvd: MPAs or zones prohibit any type of commercial fishing and place some type of restriction on recreational fishing

edom.edomv: Commercial Fishing Restricted and Recreational Fishing Prohibited
edom.edomvd: MPAs or zones prohibit any type of recreational fishing and place some type of restriction on commercial fishing
MPAs or zones prohibit any type of commercial fishing. Recreational fishing may be allowed
MPAs or zones place some type of restriction on recreational fishing, which might vary throughout the MPA according to different zones or areas. Commercial fishing may be unrestricted
MPAs or zones prohibit any type of fishing throughout the site, including both commercial and recreational
MPAs or zones place no restrictions on any type of fishing throughout the site, including both commercial and recreational
MPAs or zones with unknown fishing restrictions
MPAs or zones place some type of restriction on commercial fishing, which might vary throughout the MPA according to different zones or areas. Recreational fishing may be unrestricted

MPAs or zones place some type of restriction on all types of fishing, including both commercial and recreational. The level of restriction may vary throughout the MPA according to different zones or areas
MPAs or zones prohibit any type of recreational fishing. Commercial fishing may be allowed

attr.attrdef: Level of legal protection afforded to the site's natural and cultural resources and ecological processes

edom.edomvd: MPAs or zones that allow human access and even some potentially harmful uses, but that totally prohibit the extraction or significant destruction of natural or cultural resources.

MPAs or zones that allow human access, but that prohibit all activities that could harm the site's resources or disrupt the ecological or cultural services they provide. Examples of activities typically prohibited in no-impact MPAs include resource extraction of any kind (fishing, collecting, or mining); discharge of pollutants; disposal or

MPAs that allow some extractive activities throughout the entire site, but that use marine zoning to allocate specific uses to compatible places or times in order to reduce user conflicts and adverse impacts
MPAs or zones with a consistent level of protection and allowable activities, including certain extractive uses, across the entire protected area
Multiple-use MPAs that contain at least one legally established management zone in which all resource extraction is prohibited

MPAs or zones that restrict all human access to the area in order to prevent potential ecological disturbance, unless specifically permitted for designated special uses such as research, monitoring or restoration
MPA or zone that has been established, but has not yet officially designated it's specific level of protection.

attr.attrdef: Describes if vessel access is allowed within the MPA.

edom.edomvd: The site allows some vessel traffic, with restrictions.
Vessel traffic within the site is prohibited.
The site allows vessel access.

attr.attrdef: Describes whether anchoring in the site is permitted.

edom.edomvd: Anchoring within the site is prohibited.
The site allows some anchoring, with restrictions.
The site allows ship anchoring.

attr.attrdef: Classification of the constancy of the site throughout the year

edom.edomvd: MPAs or zones that protect specific habitats and resources, but only during fixed seasons or periods when human uses may disrupt ecologically sensitive seasonal processes such as spawning, breeding, or feeding aggregations

MPAs or zones that cycle serially and predictably among a set of fixed geographic areas in order to meet short-term conservation or management goals (such as local stock replenishment followed by renewed exploitation of recovered populations)
MPAs or zones that provide constant protection to the site throughout the year

attr.attrdef: Level of government responsible for designating and managing the site

edom.edomvd: MPA is designated and managed by multiple agencies at more than one level of government
MPA is designated and managed by a local agency
MPA is designated and managed by a territorial agency
MPA is designated and managed by a state agency
MPA is designated and managed by a federal agency

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Unique site identifier assigned by MPAC

attrdomv.udom: Consists of government level identifier combined with unique number value.

attr.attrdef: Agency responsible for managing the site
Website for the MPA created by the managing agency.
Feature geometry.
Official name of the MPA
The type of management plan developed for the site

edom.edomvd: A habitat management plan has been developed, which includes the management of the site
A species management plan has been developed, which includes the management of the site
A verbal or written community agreement has been reached for the management of the site
No management plan has been developed for the site, or the management plan is still in draft form
A management plan has been developed specifically for the site
A management plan has been developed for a broader MPA program, which includes the site
A fisheries management plan has been developed, which includes the management of the site

attr.attrdef: R
Level of restrictions on commercial fishing
Year MPA was established.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce (DOC), NOAA Fisheries (NMFS), Northwest Fisheries Science Center (NWFSC), Fishery Resource Analysis and Monitoring Division (FRAM)
